title: cafter
author: cafter
content: In my country, even $5 is considered a reasonable amount for the lower middle class. I spent $5 to purchase a seemingly worthless movie or music subscription, and I fall into the lower middle class category myself.I've begun to realize that I may be losing touch with the value of money due to exposure to the vast sums and high salaries of people online. In the past, when I had no access to the internet and a phone, I used to carefully save every cent and think twice before spending just $1. However, now I find myself spending more without a second thought.This realization struck me when I observed a lower middle-class woman desperately asking to borrow less than $1 for nearly 10 minutes, enduring shameful comments from the shop owner. She needed to borrow this money because her husband wasn't earning anything, and their financial situation was such that they didn't have the luxury of saving; they earned daily and spent daily.What can I do to remember the importance of money and spend more carefully?

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 06, 2023, 12:43:38 PMWhat can I do to remember the importance of money and spend more carefully?Spend it wisely on the things that you truly need. You don't have to restrict yourself from spending on things that are like for entertainment as long as that amount isn't going to eat a lot of portion of how much you've got. But if you're in that shoe where you barely afford to earn that amount, you must really tighten your pockets. Just remember the hardship that you've dealt with before and how far you've come now. It is okay to help other people to stand on their own when they're in need. Not everyone is fortunate as you at this time and I think that's enough motivation for you to be careful and remember how you should spend your money wisely.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: This is the reason why most of people can't become rich, when someone salary is increased, they tend to spend as much as the salary they earn.You need to learn about frugal living, when you want to buy something, don't directly buy it. Try to wait for few days or week, then remember back do you really need it or not? if you not have any problem without buy that thing, you shouldn't buy it because you're just want to fulfill your desire, not your needs.

comments.author: zaim7413
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 06, 2023, 12:43:38 PMWhat can I do to remember the importance of money and spend more carefully?You have to remember the value of money and you have to realize how difficult it is to earn money. You can easily spend more than $5 in just 5 minutes, but you can't get replacement money in just 10 minutes.Do experiments around your life, you will find the answer. Your friends will always have time to laugh with you as long as you are able to treat them to food and drink, but when you ask them for a loan, some of them will say "sorry, I don't have any money".It needs to be underlined, money doesn't have legs to walk to your wallet on its own, that's why you have to work hard to get it. So, you need to be careful in spending it.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: One thing that I always like to suggest is to set a budget for yourself and stick to it. Keep track of all your expenses no matter how small they may be. This can help you in monitoring your spending habits and increasing your awareness of where your money is going. Another excellent idea is to practice delayed gratification. When you have the urge to make a purchase take a day or two to contemplate whether it's something you genuinely need or simply a passing impulse. However don't be overly harsh, on yourself if you occasionally make mistakes. Striking a balance, between enjoying life and maintaining responsibility is crucial.

comments.author: n00ber
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 06, 2023, 12:43:38 PMWhat can I do to remember the importance of money and spend more carefully?Plan your weekly or monthly spending, and buy only what is necessary. In case you cannot control your spending when you have money in hand. I think it's best to invest the majority of your income in long-term assets, which is what I'm doing to limit wasteful spending. Because sometimes we won't be able to control our waste when we have too much money in hand. There are many people out there who are struggling but life is like that, when we have a lot of money we will consider the value of money very low and it is very difficult to get rid of that mindset without any planning or discipline.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 06, 2023, 12:43:38 PMWhat can I do to remember the importance of money and spend more carefully?If I were you, I would take a different approach. If you are earning well above your country's average income, don't forget to save and invest, thus increasing your net worth. Also have an emergency fund, and once you have all this, spend part of your money on consumption or entertainment and use the other part for donations. Imagine if you had taken out a $5 or $10 bill and given it to that woman who was asking to borrow $1, you would have given it to her. That way you will improve your net worth and help others, always being aware of what money is worth.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Each person determines the value of money according to his own financial situation and not based on the general financial situation. If you can buy a song on the Internet for $10, it can never be said that you have wasted a fortune because other people receive that $10 as a monthly salary in exchange for working 8 hours a day. Individual income rates vary from one country to another and from the capabilities of each person to another. At the same time, I cannot advise you to spend wisely because the concept of wise spending varies from one person to another as well.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 06, 2023, 12:43:38 PM~I think this happened to me when I was suddenly able to receive pretty big money in a constant 2 months or so? It really pushed my sense of money off, to the point where even after I stopped receiving that amount, my mindset was still along the lines of "oh, I should buy this, probably can" when it's way out of budget. I think the best method was to, well, just manage it properly. For me that first experience enabled me to adapt the next time it happened (when I entered the workforce). It also helped that after that, well, I started paying bills, food budget and stuff like that. I had to manage my money (the first time, well, I didn't).
